# Security Policy

Blair's documentation site is a **client-side only** website. Everything is entirely within your browser using local resources. We prioritize your privacy by ensuring your data never leaves your machine.

* **No Data Collection:** There are no advertisements, trackers, or analytics. We do not collect, view, or store any of your data.
* **Privacy:** We only save deeplinking history for a better experience and it is stored locally in your browser's cache, on your device.

> [!NOTE]
> If you click a link to an external site (ex: GitHub or Discord), you are then subject to that site's specific privacy and security policies.

---

## Managing Your Data

Since all data is stored locally, you have total control over it.

Browser Settings: Go to your browser's Privacy & Security settings.

Clear Site Data: Locate the "Cookies and Site Data" section.

Delete for blairdocs.pages.dev: Select "Manage Data" and delete whats associated with this domain.

You can also use Incognito/Private Mode so that all history is automatically wiped the moment you close the tab.

---

## Reporting a Vulnerability

**Please do not report security vulnerabilities through public GitHub issues.**

Instead, please report them via one of the following methods:

1. **Email:** blair@collector.org
2. **GitHub Private Reporting:** Use the "Report a vulnerability" button under the Security tab of this repository.

You can expect a reply within **a week**. I will provide a detailed response and a timeline for a fix if needed.

---

> [!NOTE]
> This is only for Blair's documentation site, please see our privacy policy instead for Blair: <https://blairdocs.pages.dev/#PRIVACY>
